options.content:
- Use Cases: This dashboard shows the basic Git and Code Review metrics from Azure DevOps.
- Data Source Required: Azure DevOps

targets.rawSql:
select
	count(distinct pr.id) as pull_request_count
from 
	pull_requests pr
where
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})

with _prs as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct id) as pr_count
  FROM pull_requests
  WHERE
    base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
    and $__timeFilter(created_date)
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  pr_count as "Pull Request Count"
FROM _prs
ORDER BY time

-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
select
  author_name,
	count(distinct pr.id) as merged_pull_request_count
from 
	pull_requests pr
where
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
	and pr.status = 'MERGED'
group by 1
order by 2 desc
limit 20

-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
select
  count(distinct case when status='CLOSED' then id else null end)/count(distinct case when status in ('MERGED','CLOSED') then id else null end) as ratio
from 
	pull_requests pr
where
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})

panels.title: 2.1 Ratio of unmerged Pull Requests of All Closed or Merged PRs

targets.rawSql:
-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
with _prs as (
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct case when status = 'OPEN' then id else null end) as open,
    count(distinct case when status = 'CLOSED' then id else null end) as closed,
    count(distinct case when status = 'MERGED' then id else null end) as merged
  FROM pull_requests
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(created_date)
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
    and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  open as "PR: Open",
  closed as "PR: Closed without merging",
  merged as "PR: Closed and merged"
FROM _prs
ORDER BY time

-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
select
	count(distinct pr.id) as merged_pull_request_count
from 
	pull_requests pr
where
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
	and pr.status = 'CLOSED'

panels.title: 2.3 Number of Pull Requests Closed without Merging [Selected Time Range]

targets.rawSql:
-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
SELECT
  DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
  count(distinct case when status = 'CLOSED' then id else null end)/count(distinct case when status in ('MERGED', 'CLOSED') then id else null end) as ratio
FROM pull_requests
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
  and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
group by 1

panels.title: 2.4 Ratio of unmerged PRs of All Closed or Merged PRs

targets.rawSql:
select
	avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,merged_date)/1440)
from 
	pull_requests
where 
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
	and merged_date is not null

panels.title: 2.5 Mean Time to Merge of Pull Requests

targets.rawSql:
with _prs as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -DAY(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,merged_date)/1440) as time_to_merge
  FROM pull_requests
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(created_date)
    and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  time_to_merge as "Time to Merge"
FROM _prs
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 2.6 Mean Time to Merge of Pull Requests

panels.description: Number of Pipeline runs executed in the selected time range

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  count(distinct id)
FROM 
  cicd_pipelines
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(finished_date)
  and result = 'SUCCESS'
  and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
  -- the following condition will remove the month with incomplete data
  and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)

panels.title: 3.1 Number of Successful Pipeline runs

panels.description: Number of successful Pipeline runs / Number of total Pipeline runs

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  1.0 * count(case when result = 'SUCCESS' then id else null end)/count(distinct id)
FROM cicd_pipelines
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(finished_date)
  and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
  -- the following condition will remove the month with incomplete data
  and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)

panels.title: 3.2 Mean Pipeline runs Success Rate %

targets.rawSql:
with _builds as (
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(finished_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(finished_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct case when result = 'SUCCESS' then id else null end) as successful_count,
    count(distinct case when result != 'SUCCESS' then id else null end) as failed_count
  FROM cicd_pipelines
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(finished_date)
    and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  GROUP BY 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  successful_count,
  failed_count
FROM _builds
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 3.3 Number of successful and failed pipeline runs

panels.description: Number of successful Pipeline runs / Number of total Pipeline runs

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  IF(result = '', 'Unknown', result) as result,
  count(distinct id) as build_count
FROM cicd_pipelines
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(finished_date)
  and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
  -- the following condition will remove the month with incomplete data
  and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 2 desc

panels.title: 3.4 Total Pipeline runs Result Distribution

panels.description:
1. Mean Pipeline Runs success rate over time.
2. The Pipeline runs being calculated are filtered by "workflow runs starting time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
WITH _build_success_rate as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(finished_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(finished_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    result,
    id
  FROM
    cicd_pipelines
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(finished_date)
    -- and id like "%azure%"
    and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  GROUP BY 
    time, result, id
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%m/%Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  1.0 * sum(case when result = 'SUCCESS' then 1 else 0 end)/ count(*) as "Pipeline Runs Success Rate"
FROM _build_success_rate
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 3.5 Pipeline run success rate %

panels.description:
1. Mean Pipeline runs success rate over time.
2. The Pipeline runs being calculated are filtered by "Pipeline runs starting time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  avg(duration_sec/60) as duration_in_minutes
FROM cicd_pipelines
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(finished_date)
  and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
  -- the following condition will remove the month with incomplete data
  and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)

panels.title: 3.6 Mean Pipeline runs Duration in Minutes

targets.rawSql:
WITH _builds as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(finished_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(finished_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    avg(duration_sec) as mean_duration_sec
  FROM 
    cicd_pipelines
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(finished_date)
    -- and id like "%azure%"
    and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  GROUP BY 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  mean_duration_sec
FROM _builds
ORDER BY time

options.content: This dashboard is created based on this [data schema](https://devlake.apache.org/docs/DataModels/DevLakeDomainLayerSchema). Want to add more metrics? Please follow the [guide](https://devlake.apache.org/docs/Configuration/Dashboards/GrafanaUserGuide).

list.definition: select concat(name, '--', id) as text from repos where id like 'azure%'
list.label: Repo
list.name: repo_id
list.query: select concat(name, '--', id) as text from repos where id like 'azure%'
